noun.description: An elongated seed vessel of a leguminous plant such as the pea, splitting open on both sides when ripe.
A detachable or self-contained unit on an aircraft, spacecraft, vehicle, or vessel, having a particular function.
examples: the torpedo's sensor pod contains a television camera

verb.description: (of a plant) bear or form pods.
examples: the peas have failed to pod

verb.description: Remove (peas or beans) from their pods prior to cooking.

origin: Mid 19th century (originally US): of unknown origin.
